main event: On 17 August 1956, a radar detected an object in the skies over Spragueville, Maine, although it was not visually observed.
interesting points: The radar indicated an object 3 to 4,000 yards south and at an altitude of 1 to 1.5 miles., The observation lasted for 3 minutes., The sighting occurred in daylight with no visibility restrictions., The object was estimated to be the size of 2 1/2 or 1 large 3/4., Multiple possibilities for the object's identity included balloon, aircraft, and astronomical phenomena.
